notesStmt.note: Title from marginal abbreviation; commentary title Tātparyabodhinī supplied by cataloger; alternate commentary title Pañcadaśīprakāśikā supplied by cataloger.

Manuscript was formerly part of a larger manuscript along with Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1034, Item 1035, Item 1036, Item 1037, Item 1038, Item 1039, Item 1040, Item 1041, Item 1042, Item 1043, and Item 1044.
Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout.
Watermarks on all folios, including a horse and various parts of words and letters.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Manuscript is used for contemplation and study and is a treatise on Hindu philosophy whose title is translated as Bliss of sensory objects, written from the perspective of the Advaita (non-dualism) Vedānta school of philosophy; work contains part of an extensive commentary called the Tātparyabodhinī by Rāmakṛṣṇa running parallel, above and below, the main root text.

msItem.title: Vidyānanda
ब्विद्यानन्द
msItem.colophon: Colophon: iti śrīmatparamahaṃsa[parivrājakācārya]śrībhāratitīrthavidyāraṇyamunikiṃkareṇa śrīrāmakṛṣṇākhyaviduṣāviracitā paṃcadaśīprakāśikā samāptā // // idaṃ pustakaṃ marāṭhe ity upanāmena mayūreśvara suta raṃganātha dīkṣitavasaīkarasya // śaka 1766 krodhīnāmābde nārāyaṇena likhitaṃ // śrīlakṣmīnṛsiṃhārpaṇam astu // (f. 3r).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Raṅganātha Marāṭhe, son of Mayūreśvara (colophon, f. 3r).
